channel.title: Z-buffering
channel.description:
http://services.runescape.com/m=news/behind-the-scenes--september
Z-buffering Improvements to our engine will bring a major graphical improvement to the game in the form of z-buffering. This means you will experience less 'clipping' issues (objects/scenery cutting other objects in half or sticking through each other) and find that scenery 'layers' on top of each other in a more predictable way. This will see improvements to high-paced game content like PKing and allow players to better see the threats around them. Upon release, the end result will be fewer graphical glitches in software mode and we get faster OpenGL! This also bodes well for the future, as we can now design even more impressive areas and characters, particularly for OpenGL. It also allows us to improve the interaction between players in the future, such as multi-player emotes.
wat

item.title: Z-buffering
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:6, topic:358423”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=454933.msg3335047#msg3335047 date=1283811941]
it means animations can now go outside of the square that the character is standing on
[/quote]
Ive never seen a problem with that…

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Z-buffering[/quote]Is that cos fox news doesnt have z-buffering and as such, u dont know the difference?

Read full topic

item.title: Z-buffering
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

eczema3:

it means animations can now go outside of the square that the character is standing on

Ive never seen a problem with that…

en.wikipedia.org

Z-buffering

In computer graphics, z-buffering, also known as depth buffering, is the management of image depth coordinates in 3D graphics, usually done in hardware, sometimes in software. It is one solution to the visibility problem, which is the problem of deciding which elements of a rendered scene are visible, and which are hidden. Z-buffering has first been described in 1974 by Wolfgang Straßer in Chapter 6 (page 6-1) of his PhD thesis. The painter's algorithm is another common solution which, though Wh...

Read full topic

item.title: Z-buffering
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

http://services.runescape.com/m=news/behind-the-scenes--september

Z-buffering

Improvements to our engine will bring a major graphical improvement to the game in the form of z-buffering. This means you will experience less ‘clipping’ issues (objects/scenery cutting other objects in half or sticking through each other) and find that scenery ‘layers’ on top of each other in a more predictable way. This will see improvements to high-paced game content like PKing and allow players to better see the threats around them.

Upon release, the end result will be fewer graphical glitches in software mode and we get faster OpenGL! This also bodes well for the future, as we can now design even more impressive areas and characters, particularly for OpenGL. It also allows us to improve the interaction between players in the future, such as multi-player emotes.
